content: woven dishcloth © 2008 andrea moberly materials using f hook worsted weight cotton abbreviations/special stitches us terminology used slip_stitch - slip_stitch single_crochet - single_crochet chain - chain double_crochet - double_crochet fpdc - front post double_crochet bpdc - back post double_crochet pattern foundation row make a chain that is a multiple of 6 + 2 row 1 in 4th chain from hook work a double_crochet make a double_crochet in each chain across turn row 2 slip_stitch around post of double_crochet below chain 3 work fpdc in each of next 2 double_crochet work bpdc in each of next 3 double_crochet *work fpdc in each of next 2 double_crochet work bpdc in each of next 3 double_crochet repeat from * across turn repeat row 2 you will be working fpdc in the bpdc and working bpdc in the fpdc until the cloth is desired length border work a single_crochet border around making 1 single_crochet in each double_crochet 2 single_crochet in each corner 2 single_crochet along the side of each double_crochet row and 1 single_crochet in each chain st from foundation chain **feel free to use this pattern for personal use or profit please just credit me with my name and web address if you post the pattern elsewhere ** © 2008 andrea moberly www knitsandknots net
